body.p:
Louisville Ky Nov. 22nd 1864
To His Excellency
Governer of Kentucky

I desire to state that the Regt. to which I belong is now at this place and will be mustered out of the service in a few days the Regt. is about five hundred Strong. From the troubles which exist at the time in the vicinity of our Houses_ it will be impossible for us to live without some sort of organization. I have confessed with quite a number of the men of the Regt. in the subject
I am convinced that the Regt can be recognized, if they will be allowed to serve in the vacinity of their Houses --

If such permissions are granted I request the authority to raise a Regiment, for State Service, for the term of one years to be stationed at Lebanon Ky -- for the protection of Central Kentucky -- Hoping that my request will be granted

I am Your Humble Servant
Geo W Riley
Capt 10th Ky Vol In Ky:

Louisville Ky
Nov 22" 1864 --
Riley George W.
Capt ^10d^19th Ky Infy
To the Gov.
Desires authority to raise a regiment for one year, state service, to be stationed at Lebanon Ky --
L B No 8 -- 1864 P. 168
Recd A. G. O. Nov 24th 1864_
